review_content: I love this little duo more than I thought I would. I have a light, warm complexion and the shades in this actually compliment my skin really nicely and give a natural flush. I’ve been using this more recently on my no makeup-makeup days; just concealer, this duo, eyebrows, and maybe mascara.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Perfect for Porcelain Skin, Great on the Go/Travel
review_content:
I have such a hard time finding highlighters that work for my porcelain skin/pink undertones. Most highlighters look darker than my complexion calls for, especially in a set/palette. This product doesn't disappoint! Both the blush and highlighter suit my skin beautifully. It's long-lasting, and has a shimmer finish for a lit-from-within glow. Not to mention it's the perfect size, when I'm traveling for work or fun I'm never without it! If you're concerned about the size of the mini, don't be. I've had this for over 6 months and haven't even made a noticeable dent yet (mind you, I wear a lot of different products, but given that this is a frequent go-to, that says something).

I think partly the blush is a tiny bit dark for me (I'm very pale) so requires a light hand and good blending, and most days I'm slapping make-up on and out the door with as little effort as possible, and the texture of the powders feels a bit chalky to me and hard to blend. Definitely prefer my Hourglass minis. The packaging is really pretty, but overall this wasn't enough to convert me to ND powders.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Red', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
This has quickly become my favorite blush and highlight! On my pale skin, it's just enough to bring me back to life! I was worried that the highlighter would be too dark, but it's the perfect champagne for me. Some reviews complain that it's not pigmented - I definitely disagree! I've used this blush as a crease/transition shade on my eyes when doing a really simple monochromatic look. I did use another foiled/shimmery champagne eyeshadow because I wanted an intense shimmer on the eyelids, but the highlighter in this palette is the perfect blinding glow for the face without being sparkly or emphasizing texture. I have a tiny scar on my cheekbone and somehow this even smoothed it out and made it way less apparent. I really love this mini palette and, although it's small, I've barely made a dent with regular use over the last few months.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: Don't lose hope! Remove the top layer!
review_content:
I totally understand why people give this 1 star and why people give it 5 stars. It is definitely a matter of getting the product going for it to actually work. I bought this on impulse since it was such a pretty little package and was so upset when I went to use it and there was literally NO color. Like seriously, none. This is definitely where all the 1 star reviews are coming from. BUT... after seeing it on my vanity and wanting to get at least some use out of it, I decided to read through some of the 5-star reviews to see why the people who loved it gave it such high praises. One reviewer wrote that you had to get through the top layer before the product gives some color payoff. I took a brush that was a little more coarse and really scraped off that top layer. Then when I took my blush brush and picked up some of the layer below IT WORKED! It actually has a ton of color and I actually had to wipe some off my cheeks to make it more subtle. I got a beautiful coral color and the highlighter is dewy but natural. I am so happy I saw that one review because this is now one of my favorite things to keep in my purse for touchups throughout the day. I saw a lot of reviews said this must only be for very fair skin tones, but I am definitely a deeper olive color (Latina) and this looks lovely on my skin tone too. I really think it is a matter of getting that top layer off. If it weren't for that hiccup, I would have given this 5-stars.

user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I LOVE this little duo palette SO MUCH!!! Every time I have worn this duo my husband has complimented me on my cheeks looking beautiful and glowy. My Morphe E4 blush brush fits perfectly and ABH highlighting brush fits great too! Highlight doesn't emphasize my pores or texture.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: My first ND purchase, and definitely not my last! The blush is a beautiful pinky coral with a subtle gold sheen. It picks up beautifully with my natural-bristle blush brush. The glow side is a flattering pale champagne that catches the light when I turn my cheeks. I apply it on top of a cream highlight when I want extra glow. I'd love to see this blush duo offered in more colors!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: Perfect duo to compliment any look!
review_content: I received this as a Christmas present and absolutely love it! It's a beautiful compact and the powders are very high quality! I didn't have any issue with a top layer as some have mentioned. These products are subtle but buildable. The blush is natural and glowy! The highlighter is beautiful... natural with a little something extra sheen! I adore it!

user_specs: ['Age 18-24', 'Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: I don't wear makeup a lot, so I tend to avoid buying full-sized products as they go bad before I can get my money's worth :( But THIS! This is the perfect size and the product is fantastic! I stick to more natural looks, and this suits that perfectly! The highlighter is so pretty and the blush gives a nice, soft hue to the cheeks. Plus, the size is just so cute :) I highly reccommend this!

review_content: PORTABLE & GORGEOUS !!! This is easily applied with your finger!
